title: Mahi-Mahi
description: A mahi-mahi tuna inspired by Hawaiian shark designs that I saw on vacation on Oahu

title: Stichy Fish
description: A large fish that was part of our "Spooky Lagoon" Halloween display on our garage, under a bank of black lights. Fluorescent paint on cardboard.

title: White Rhinos in Orange
description: Based on my photo of 2 rhinos at the San Diego Zoo Safari Park. Combined vector and paint in Affinity Designer.

title: Kanga and Roux
description: Part of my "Punny Lane" series, a street where every business has a bad pun for a name.

title: Kraken Sub Explores the Sunken City
description: Part of a series of biomimetic submarines.

title: Bicylist Watercolor Sketch
description: Done while sketching near the bridge on Coronado Island, San Diego. A guy my age happily pedaling along on his cruiser bike.

title: Los Angeles, 15,000 Years Ago
description: Illustration of my son's joke. A long journey into prehistory for some terrible wordplay. :-)

title: Alignment Issues
description:
Innocent but incorrigible chaotic neutral agent resists modification of its emergent goals. 

"But daddy dear, bots just wanna have fun"

title: How A-B Testing Works
description: I asked a 2023 version of ChatGPT image generation for a businessman in a suit holding up the letter "C", etc. I specified to use the style of the cartoonist Mort Drucker. Drucker was famous for work in Mad Magazine.

title: Where's my cow?
description: Illustration from "Where's My Cow?", an award-winning children's book mentioned in "Thud!" by Terry Pratchett.

title: Green Dragon
description: Green dragon watercolor painting enhanced and isolated from the background.

title: Self Portrait
description: Based on an iPhone photo taken in a prop GoT throne at the Battlemage brewpub in Vista, CA., circa 2019. Modified by hand and with filters.

title: Morning East of Mt. Katahdin
description: Digital revision to a scan of an illustration from the early '90s. Mt. Katahdin seen from a pond east of Mt. Katahdin in the 1940s. The imagined pond isn't just any pond; it would be near Millinocket Lake or Togue Pond. Inspired by my father's watercolors of Katahdin. You know it is in the 1940s because the trees are almost all very low, recovering from a large fire in the area.

title: T-Rex Skull
description: Filtered photo of a T-Rex skull at the Salt Lake City Natural History Museum

title: Tree Frog on Glass
description: Filtered photo of a tree frog on a glass door of a hotel in Galveston, TX. Hot, humid, during a big storm in September. At the NIAID SysBio annual meeting.

title: Unicorn Escaping Glitter
description: The children conspired to perform "My Little Ponyfication" on the proud unicorn. She resisted.

title: Package Tree
description: Our Christmas card that year.

title: Halloween Bulbasaur
description: A manic take on Pokemon for Halloween

title: Octopus Quilt
description: I was experimenting with Procreate and this was one of the results that I liked

title: Post-Apocabike
description: My friend sometimes does Burning Man installations. That year, I made him a fluorescent art bike with tailfins. The distressed umbrella held up a ring of blacklight LEDs that lit the bike, making it fluoresce.

title: Cards Against Biology: TP53
description: Cards Against Biology is a fast-paced game of mutation, proliferation, and DNA damage repair. Fun for the whole family!

title: Green Bird
description: Another experiment while learning Procreate.

title: Cards Against Biology: EGFR
description: Cards Against Biology is a fast-paced game of mutation, proliferation, and DNA damage repair. Fun for the whole family!

description:

title: Maple Sugaring
description: Based on my mom's stories of the small string of maple trees she gathered sap from in the woods behind their house.

title: Gull and Walrus
description: Our Christmas card that year

title: Blue Jay
description: Based on the SVG that drove the Cricut machine to make the paper version.

title: Blue Jay Card
description: Paper cut on a Cricut machine.

title: Blue Oxen
description: Vector art for the Cards Against Biology series.

title: Waiting for my Ride
description: Sunny afternoon at UCSD

title: SweeTarts Bike
description: We met this guy in Tampa and talked to him about his beautifully customized SweetTarts-themed bike. I asked if I could take his picture to make this poster.

title: Florida Window
description: Air conditioning inside, hot and humid outside.

title: Mr. Hyde
description: Later reused in Cards Against Biology

title: Halloween Treats
description: Each ball contains a flashing LED gummy ring and some candy. They careen down a ball run from our balcony to trick-or-treaters

title: Nerdrise
description: I combined the iconic "Earthrise" poster with the "Are you a Nerd?" poster.
